description: An Israeli airstrike in a Beirut suburb killed at least 37 people, including senior Hezbollah leaders. The attack targeted an underground meeting of Hezbollah commanders, resulting in significant casualties and damage. This escalation has heightened cross-border violence and diplomatic tensions, prompting Lebanon's Prime Minister to cancel his planned UN visit.
title: Deadly Israeli airstrike in Beirut kills 37

description: The return of hilsa diplomacy has once again bridged borders in time for a festive celebration.
title: Cheers before Durga puja: Bangladesh to send 3k tonnes of hilsa to India
5-yr jail for retd cop for taking Rs 500 bribe in 2014

description: An ace swimmer is aiming to drown NC stalwart Omar Abdullah's electoral hopes in Ganderbal, his family bastion. The "legend" of Bashir Mir, PDP's candidate, is that he often plunges into the choppy waters of Sind river to rescue people without caring for his own life.
title: J&K's ace swimmer looks to sink Omar's poll hopes

description: H Mahalakshmi Das, aged 29, was found brutally murdered in her Bengaluru residence. Her body had been dismembered and stored in a refrigerator. The discovery was made after the building owner reported a foul smell to her family. Police are now investigating the case to determine the perpetrator(s).
title: Bengaluru woman's body chopped into 30 pieces, stuffed in fridge

description: Centre Saturday cleared SC collegium's recommendations and appointed CJs for eight HCs, just a day after SC sought explanation from it for the delay. It also appointed Jharkhand HC CJ, for which the state had moved a contempt plea against the Centre. President signed warrants of appointment for CJs of Delhi, MP, Meghalaya, Himachal, Kerala, Madras, J&K, Ladakh & Jharkhand.
title: Centre names CJs for eight high courts, day after Supreme Court prod

description: A day after Supreme Court took a dim view of Karnataka high court judge V Srishananda's purported gratuitous reference to a Muslim-majority Bengaluru locality as Pakistan, he expressed "sincere regrets" Saturday. About his misogynistic comment, he said it was not aimed at a woman advocate, but her client.
title: Regret 'Pakistan' remark: Karnataka HC judge

description: Atishi has taken over as Delhi's new chief minister from Arvind Kejriwal, managing 13 key portfolios such as finance and power. The cabinet features both returning ministers and newcomer Mukesh Kumar Ahlawat. Atishi is now the 17th woman to hold the CM position in independent India.
title: Atishi 17th woman to hold CM’s post in independent India

description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi met US President Joe Biden in Greenville, Delaware, to strengthen the India-US Comprehensive Global Strategic Partnership. They discussed new cooperation areas and global issues like Ukraine. PM Modi will also meet Australian and Japanese leaders at the Quad Summit and address the Indian community in Long Island.
title: 'Struck by our ability to ...': Biden after bilateral talks with PM Modi
As drought threat grows, a 'dead tree' emoji is coming
French President Macron appoints new govt in shift to right
Europe needs to be tough on migrants: Danish PM
Post-rain, cracks appear at Taj Mahal: Verses fade, gems erode
NCP (SCP) requests SC to freeze ‘clock’ symbol

description: Alia Bhatt and Vedang Raina appeared on the season two premiere of The Great Indian Kapil Show with Karan Johar and Vasan Bala. Sunil Grover's portrayal of Dafli was notable. Karan Johar shared an emotional story about his bond with Alia, calling her his first daughter, a sentiment that Alia echoed.
title: TGIKS2: Karan Johar reveals Alia asked for his permission but for what?

description: Vice President Kamala Harris and former President Donald Trump are scheduled for a second presidential debate on October 23, organized by CNN. Harris's campaign stressed the significance of another debate for voters' assessment. The format mirrors their previous encounter, which Trump commended. The Trump campaign has not yet issued a response.
title: Kamala Harris accepts CNN invite for second presidential debate

description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi arrived in Wilmington for a bilateral meeting with President Joe Biden during the QUAD summit. The visit was overshadowed by US election distractions and a contentious White House meeting with Sikh radicals. Discussions extended beyond Indo-Pacific issues to include global concerns like China and Russia, amidst an uncertain political climate in Washington.
title: US muddies Modi visit with public outreach to Sikh radicals

description: An 18-year-old Canadian woman named Sarah Badshaw has been arrested for stealing a Porsche and injuring its owner in Mississauga. Captured on a doorbell camera, she faces charges like dangerous operation causing bodily harm and theft. The stolen vehicle was later found abandoned in the same area.
title: Watch: Woman steals Porsche, runs over owner in driveway

description: Daughters Day is set for 22nd September 2024. Celebrated annually on the fourth Sunday of September, this day honors daughters by expressing love and appreciation. The article offers 50 wishes, messages, and quotes for sharing with daughters to make the day memorable and emphasize their importance in our lives.
title: Happy Daughter's Day 2024: Top 50 wishes, messages, and quotes

description: The interim government of Bangladesh has announced it will allow the export of 3,000 tonnes of hilsa fish to India for Durga Puja from October 9 to 13. This decision reverses an earlier ban meant to ensure domestic supply and continues a tradition seen as a goodwill gesture towards India.
title: Bangladesh reverses ban on export of Hilsa fish to India ahead of Durga Puja

description: Virender Sehwag transitioned from a middle-order batsman to an opener under Sourav Ganguly's captaincy. Initially reluctant, he eventually thrived in the new role, achieving three triple centuries in Test cricket and setting a record with 219 runs in an ODI. Ganguly's strategic decision was crucial in shaping Sehwag's successful career.
title: 'Can you write that': The game changing conversation between Ganguly and Sehwag

description: Virat Kohli's decision not to review an LBW call in the first Test against Bangladesh became a talking point. Reactions from captain Rohit Sharma and umpire Richard Kettleborough went viral on social media. India neared victory with centuries from Shubman Gill and Rishabh Pant, while Bangladesh required 357 more runs at the end of day three.
title: Kohli spotted chatting with umpire after viral dismissal

description: In Bengaluru, the dismembered body of 29-year-old Mahalakshmi was found stored in a refrigerator. The crime is believed to have taken place about a week ago. Police are investigating with assistance from forensic experts and a dog squad. This brutal incident has been compared to another similar case that occurred in Delhi last year.
title: Woman's chopped-up body found inside fridge in Bengaluru, probe underway

description: Atishi took office as Delhi's youngest chief minister and called on residents to re-elect Arvind Kejriwal in the upcoming assembly election. She cautioned that the Bharatiya Janata Party could revoke current benefits such as free electricity and enhanced public services if Kejriwal is not chosen. Atishi shared her mixed feelings about this leadership change.
title: 'Must bring back ...': Atishi In first statement as Delhi CM

description: Bad light stopped play on the third day of the first India-Bangladesh Test in Chennai. Rohit Sharma considered using spinners, but Mohammed Siraj humorously offered to bowl spin, which was dismissed with laughter by teammates and umpires. Bangladesh ended the day at 158-4, needing another 357 runs to win.
title: Rohit's response to Siraj's 'spin' offer leaves teammates in splits

description: Atishi Marlena took oath as Delhi's chief minister, becoming the youngest to hold this position. With assembly elections approaching in February next year, her administration aims to expedite key policies and welfare schemes. Previously, she held major portfolios under Arvind Kejriwal's government, gaining a strong reputation for policy reforms.
title: Atishi sworn in as Delhi CM, youngest leader to hold top post

description: Rishabh Pant celebrated his return to Test cricket with a century in India's first Test against Bangladesh in Chennai. This marked his sixth Test hundred, matching MS Dhoni's record for Indian wicketkeepers. India set a target of 515 runs, and Bangladesh reached 158 for 4 before bad light ended play on the third day.
title: Watch: Rishabh Pant seen praying to his bat, gloves, helmet

description: Atishi Marlena took oath as Delhi's third woman chief minister, drawing criticism from BJP leaders who labeled her a 'dummy CM' under Arvind Kejriwal's control. Despite this, Atishi must address key issues and implement important policies ahead of the assembly elections scheduled for February next year.
title: 'Dummy CM ... new Manomohan Singh': BJP on Atishi becoming Delhi CM

description: Tata Consultancy Services (TCS) has launched a new delivery centre in Warsaw, Poland, aiming to double its workforce to over 1200 within a year. This expansion signifies TCS' commitment to the European market and leverages Poland's growing ICT talent pool for niche technology skills and cognitive business processes.
title: TCS expands operations in Poland with new delivery centre: What this means for the company's European operations

description: A Tamil Nadu police officer's unique wedding invitation, styled like an Apple MacBook, has captured significant online attention. The card features a Google search bar with wedding details and closely resembles a real laptop. Deputy Superintendent of Police Manoj Kumar shared the video on Instagram, garnering thousands of views and comments appreciating the creativity.
title: Watch: Tamil Nadu cop's Apple MacBook-inspired wedding invitation goes viral

description: Rishabh Pant and Shubman Gill's centuries propelled India to declare their second innings at 287 for 4 on the third day of the first Test against Bangladesh in Chennai. Bangladesh responded with a score of 158 for four before poor light halted play. They need another 357 runs to secure victory.
title: 1st Test: Pant, Gill emotional tons put India in command
Reliance Jio, Airtel and Vodafone Idea lose customers after July price hike; this telco gained users

description: A final-year computer science student named Kushal Gowda was arrested for recording inside a women's toilet at his college near Kumbalagodu. He hid in the ladies' toilet and placed his mobile phone in the ventilator to record. A girl discovered the phone and raised an alarm, leading to his arrest after a complaint from the college management.
title: College student held in B'luru for placing camera in ladies' toilet

description: Before Prime Minister Narendra Modi's US visit, White House officials met with Sikh activists to discuss safeguarding Americans from transnational repression. Representatives from major Sikh organizations expressed gratitude and called for further action. This meeting coincides with new legislative efforts addressing such issues, including a bill introduced by Congressman Adam Schiff.
title: White House officials meet pro-Khalistan groups ahead of PM Modi's visit

description: The iPhone 16 has been released for purchase, with quick commerce platforms like BigBasket and Blinkit offering deliveries within 10 minutes. Social media was abuzz with jokes and memes about the swift service. Customers in cities including Delhi NCR, Mumbai, Pune, and Bengaluru received their new iPhones almost immediately after ordering.
title: ‘Dhaniya, Pudina to … ’, these iPhone 16 memes go viral on internet

description: On the third day of the first Test between India and Bangladesh in Chennai, Virat Kohli and Rishabh Pant shared a lighthearted moment by exchanging sunglasses on the field. Bangladesh closed at 158/4 while chasing a target of 515 runs. Ravichandran Ashwin took three wickets to dent Bangladesh's hopes further.
title: Kohli, Pant share a fun moment, exchange sunglasses on-field

description: Rahul Gandhi defended his comments made in the US about Sikhs, accusing the BJP of lying to silence him. He stressed that all Indians should freely practice their religion. The BJP urged him to retract his statement, citing Sikh groups' concerns. Gandhi reiterated his commitment to India's unity and equality.
title: 'I want to ask every Sikh brother ...': Rahul Gandhi reacts to row over remarks made in US

description: On Friday Night SmackDown, Tiffany Stratton made an impactful appearance with her new wrestling gear designed by No Gimmick Gear. The black, rhinestone-studded outfit drew significant attention on Instagram. Tiffany is a former gymnast and NXT Women's Champion who signed with WWE in August 2021 and currently holds the Money In The Bank Contract.
title: Tiffany Stratton flaunts her beauty in the latest Instagram post
'Whatever has come to light ...': Kharge reacts to Tirupati laddu row

description: Cristiano Ronaldo, Lionel Messi, Tiger Woods, Conor McGregor, and David Beckham own some of the most luxurious yachts in the world. These vessels come with amenities like multiple cabins, gyms, Jacuzzis, and expansive relaxation areas. Their yachts symbolize their extravagant lifestyles and serve as personal retreats on the water.
title: Top sports stars who own expensive yachts: Ronaldo, Messi and more

description: Rahul Gandhi has spoken to the parents of Anna Sebastian, a 26-year-old EY employee who died due to work-related stress. He assured them he would advocate for better working conditions. The All India Professional Congress will launch an awareness movement and helpline for corporate professionals facing similar challenges.
title: EY employee death: Rahul Gandhi speaks to kin, vows to 'personally fight' for justice

description: In Bihar's Saharsa, villagers hurriedly seized fish from a biofloc tank just after Chief Minister Nitish Kumar released them at an exhibition. The event was intended to promote aquaculture initiatives but turned chaotic when attendees rushed to collect the fish, raising questions about managing crowds at public events.
title: Watch: Nitish releases fish at event, crowd rushes to steal them right after he leaves

description: Amul has filed a complaint with Ahmedabad Cyber Crime Police against false social media claims alleging that its ghee, used in Tirupati temple's prasadam laddoos, contains animal fat. Amul clarified it never supplied ghee to the temple and emphasized that their product undergoes stringent quality checks.
title: Amul files complaint against 'misinformation campaign' linking it to Tirupati laddoos row

description: Former Pakistan cricketer Basit Ali compared Rishabh Pant's aggressive batting approach to Virender Sehwag's style. After recovering from a serious accident, Pant scored a century against Bangladesh in Chennai. His impressive performance included forming a crucial 167-run partnership with Shubman Gill, helping India set an imposing target of 515 runs.
title: 'There are two batters in India...': Ex-Pak player hails Pant

description: A girl traveling from Noida to Ghaziabad on her scooter was injured after being hit by a car in Noida's Sector 25. Thrown against a flyover pillar, she was rescued by passersby and police. The girl and two rescuers were hospitalized, while the vehicle involved has been impounded for investigation.
title: Girl hit by vehicle while riding scooter, ends up stuck on pillar

description: Mallikarjun Kharge denied accusations by PM Modi and Amit Shah that the Congress-National Conference alliance in Jammu and Kashmir aligns with Pakistan's interests. He asserted that Congress prioritises local welfare. Kharge criticised BJP for not fulfilling promises, referencing Modi’s 2015 visit to Pakistan as a distraction from their failures. He also said that BJP may love India but is married to Pakistan.
title: 'Married to Pak ...': Kharge's jab at PM over remarks on NC-Cong tie-up in J&K

description: The Israel Defense Forces confirmed the elimination of Ibrahim Aqil, head of Hezbollah's Operations Unit, in an intelligence-based strike in Beirut. Several other senior Hezbollah commanders were also killed. The IDF stated that Aqil was planning significant attacks against Israel. This action is part of ongoing efforts to neutralize threats from Hezbollah and ensure security in northern Israel.
title: 'Hiding among civilians': Israel reveals how IDF eliminated top Hezbollah commander

description: In Mumbai's Dharavi slum, tensions escalated as residents opposed the BMC's plan to demolish part of a mosque. Hundreds blocked officials from entering the area, leading to heavy police deployment. The situation remains under control as talks continue between mosque representatives, BMC officials, and police to resolve the issue.
title: Tensions in Dharavi as locals thwart BMC's move to raze part of mosque

description: Microsoft has committed to a 20-year partnership with Constellation Energy to reactivate the Three Mile Island nuclear plant's Unit 1 reactor in Pennsylvania. This move is designed to supply carbon-free electricity for Microsoft's expanding AI data centres, aligning with its objective of operating all global data centres on clean energy by 2025.
title: This Nuclear Power plant in US is reopening for Microsoft, here’s the ‘big why’

description: Air Marshal Amar Preet Singh will assume the role of chief of the Indian Air Force following the retirement of Air Chief Marshal V R Chaudhari on September 30. Commissioned in December 1984, Singh has held various significant command and staff positions, including vice-chief and air officer commanding-in-chief of the Central Air Command.
title: Air Marshal Amar Preet Singh to take over as next IAF chief

description: On Day 3 of the first Test against Bangladesh in Chennai, Shubman Gill scored an unbeaten 119 off 176 balls, helping India declare their second innings at 287/4 and set a target of 515. His performance was complemented by Rishabh Pant's sixth Test century, making a strong return to the format after nearly two years.
title: Shubman Gill becomes only the second India batter after Dravid to...

description: Virat Kohli's return to the Test mould after a break saw him scoring 6 and 17 in the two innings of the Chennai Test against Bangladesh. This has led to a further dip in his performance since the start of 2024. While Kohli strives to maintain work-life balance in the twilight of his playing career, the batting legend still has some unfinished business -- to win the elusive WTC title.
title: 2024 not turning out to be a 'Virat' year for Kohli

description: A fatal accident occurred in Gurgaon when an SUV driven by repeat offender Kuldeep Kumar Thakur collided with a biker on the wrong side of Golf Course Road. Thakur, who may lack a valid driving license and has prior traffic violations, is out on bail as police continue their investigation and await his license submission.
title: Gurgaon horror: Driver of SUV that killed biker doesn't have licence?

description: In a recent social media post, Mukesh Khanna criticized major celebrities for promoting pan masala and alcohol brands. He questioned their sense of social responsibility and highlighted the detrimental effects on society and youth. Khanna emphasized that financial gain drives these endorsements, urging a halt to such practices due to their harmful consequences.
title: Mukesh Khanna slams 'big stars' for endorsing pan masala, gutkha and alcohol

description: Qualcomm has recently approached Intel regarding a potential takeover as Intel faces substantial business challenges, a report has said. While talks are ongoing, no official offer has been made yet. Qualcomm is exploring various options, including acquiring parts of Intel's design business. Both US-based chipmakers have declined to comment on the discussions.
title: Qualcomm planning to buy Intel: Here’s what we know so far

description: A female student from Andhra Pradesh at NIT Patna was discovered hanging in her hostel room on the Bihta campus. A suicide note was found, and police were notified around 10.15 pm on Friday. The body has been sent for post-mortem, and further investigation is ongoing.
title: 2nd year student of NIT-Patna found hanging in hostel room

description: Shiv Sena (UBT) leader Sanjay Raut criticized Prime Minister Narendra Modi after Maharashtra postponed Mumbai University senate elections for a second time. He questioned the government's commitment to the one nation one election bill amid delays in local polls. Aditya Thackery also condemned this move, calling it a threat to democracy and evidence of BJP's fear of losing.
title: PM Modi talks of one nation one election, can't conduct BMC polls: Raut

description: Union home minister Amit Shah criticized PDP, NC, and Congress for arming J&K youth while BJP provided laptops. He praised PM Modi's leadership for transforming the region from terrorism to peace. Shah emphasized grassroots democracy and assured that terrorism would not return to the Valley.
title: Pak fears PM Modi, would not dare to open shelling here: Amit Shah in J&K

description: The Tirumala Tirupati Devasthanams has taken steps to restore the sanctity of its laddu prasadam after lab tests revealed adulteration with beef fat and fish oil. Following complaints about changes in taste, the temple trust temporarily halted using cow-based products for making prasadam, ensuring purity and quality are maintained.
title: 'Sanctity of laddu restored': Temple trust amid Tirupati 'prasadam' row

description: Congress leader Shashi Tharoor has called for legislation to implement an 8-hour workday, five days a week, following the death of a 26-year-old EY employee allegedly due to work-related stress. Tharoor plans to raise the issue in Parliament, emphasizing the need to eliminate workplace inhumanity through stringent punishments and fines.
title: Tharoor speaks to late EY worker's dad; bats for '8 hrs, 5 days' formula

description: OYO, a travel tech platform, announced its agreement to acquire Motel 6 and Studio 6 brands from Blackstone Real Estate for $525 million. The acquisition is set to close in the fourth quarter of 2024. OYO aims to enhance these brands using its technology and marketing expertise while maintaining their iconic status.
title: Oyo to acquire G6 Hospitality from Blackstone in $525 million deal

description: Pakistan allrounder Faheem Ashraf has revealed that friendships with umpires influence decisions in domestic cricket, often involving the exchange of phone numbers later on. He criticized the poor umpiring standards in Pakistan's domestic circuit, pointing out that top umpires have moved to higher levels. The Champions Cup's TV coverage has exposed these issues.
title: 'Dosti-yaari with umpires saves us': Pak all-rounder's big revelation

description: Jasprit Bumrah is celebrated for his precise bowling and ability to perform under pressure. Former cricketer Parthiv Patel highlights Bumrah's evolution and dedication. In the first Test against Bangladesh in Chennai, Bumrah took four wickets, reaching 400 international wickets. His impressive record spans across Tests, ODIs, and T20Is. What sets Bumrah apart from other pacers around the globe?
title: How Bumrah mastered the art of toe-crushing yorkers

description: Rishabh Pant's comeback to Test cricket after 635 days was marked by a century, equalling Mahendra Singh Dhoni's record for most centuries by an Indian wicketkeeper-batsman. His significant partnership with Shubman Gill bolstered India's lead against Bangladesh. Key performances from Jasprit Bumrah, Ravichandran Ashwin, and Ravindra Jadeja also contributed to India's commanding position.
title: Pant marks Test comeback with record-equalling century

description: An attempted derailment near Kim Railway Station in Surat was thwarted after miscreants removed fishplates and keys from the track. Service was swiftly restored. Concurrently, foundation work for eight bullet train stations in Gujarat has been completed, and noise barriers are being installed along the Mumbai-Ahmedabad Bullet Train Corridor.
title: Train mishap averted after fishplates, keys found on tracks in Surat

description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi’s ability to connect personally with world leaders is exemplified by an exchange during his 2014 US visit. While riding in President Obama’s stretch limousine, Modi remarked that it was almost as large as his mother’s house. This candid revelation highlighted Modi’s humble beginnings and fostered a deeper bond between the two leaders.
title: When PM Modi compared size of Obama's car to his mom's house

description: Ayodhya's Ram Temple chief priest Acharya Satyendra Das expressed his dismay over reports of animal fat in ghee used for Tirumala laddus. More than three quintals of these laddus were brought to Ayodhya for the Ram Temple consecration ceremony in January. Das urged strict action against those responsible.
title: '1 lakh Tirupati laddus distributed during Ram temple consecration ceremony'

description: Jasprit Bumrah achieved his 400th international wicket during the first Test against Bangladesh in Chennai. Former cricketer Sanjay Manjrekar praised Bumrah's all-round abilities and sharp cricketing mind, calling him a bowler without a weakness. At age 30, Bumrah joins the ranks of India's great bowlers like Anil Kumble and Ravichandran Ashwin.
title: 'Bowler without a weakness': Sanjay Manjrekar lauds Jasprit Bumrah

description: Parvin Dabas, a prominent Bollywood actor and co-founder of the Pro Panja League, was hospitalized following a car accident on Saturday morning. He is currently receiving treatment in the ICU at Holy Family Hospital in Bandra. His wife Preeti Jhangiani is present at the hospital. The Pro Panja League has issued a statement regarding the incident.
title: 'My Name Is Khan' actor Parvin Dabas admitted in ICU after road accident

description: Rishabh Pant created a lighthearted moment on the third day of the first Test against Bangladesh in Chennai by suggesting a field placement to opposition captain Najmul Shanto, who followed his advice. India opted not to enforce the follow-on after dismissing Bangladesh for 149 and resumed their second innings on Saturday at 81 for 3, leading by 308 runs.
title: Cheeky Pant helps Bangladesh set field on Day 3 of Chennai Test

description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi embarks on a three-day US visit, attending the Quad Summit hosted by President Joe Biden in Wilmington. He will also participate in the Summit of the Future in New York and address a community event. The visit aims to deepen India-US strategic partnership and discuss global issues for mutual benefit.
title: 'Will have bilateral meeting with Biden': PM Modi as he departs for US

description: Congress leader Shashi Tharoor has called for legislation to implement an 8-hour workday, five days a week, following the death of a 26-year-old EY employee allegedly due to work-related stress. Tharoor plans to raise the issue in Parliament, emphasizing the need to eliminate workplace inhumanity through stringent punishments and fines.
title: Tharoor speaks to late EY worker's dad; bats for '8 hrs, 5 days' formula

description: Indian Army troops displayed their proficiency in conducting night operations in Ladakh with ALH Dhruv helicopters. Pilots noted the heightened difficulty of night flying due to instrument dependency. Technical supervisors elaborated on pre-flight preparations and stringent safety protocols, crucial for successful missions, especially in winter conditions.
title: Watch: Army troops' night operation skills in high-altitude Ladakh

description: A 13-year-old Dalit girl in Mathura was abducted and gang-raped by three youths in a moving van after being drugged. She was later abandoned under a flyover. Her family reported the crime to the police, who have identified two suspects and are actively pursuing their arrest.
title: 'Offered water laced with drugs': 13-yr-old Dalit gang-raped in car

description: The Kerala Congress' Twitter account highlighted identical tweets about the Tirupati Laddu controversy, where users claimed their mothers fell ill after consuming the prasad. This coincides with national outrage over lab tests confirming animal fat in the sacred offering, prompting calls for a CBI investigation and comments from political leaders like YS Jagan Mohan Reddy and Rahul Gandhi.
title: 'One nation, one mom': Congress takes dig at viral Tirupati laddu tweets amid prasad row

description: Pakistani farmers are advertising counterfeit versions of India's Pusa 1121 and Pusa 1509 basmati rice on social media, targeting global markets. This trend has concerned Indian farmers and scientists about losing market share. The Indian government has raised the issue with Pakistan, citing unauthorized use of these prized varieties developed by the Indian Agricultural Research Institute.
title: Rice thieves: India's basmati success now Pakistan’s new label

description: External affairs minister S Jaishankar is expected to meet Bangladesh's Touhid Hossain next week at the UN General Assembly in New York. Discussions will focus on restoring law and order in Bangladesh, addressing concerns over minority threats, and reaffirming India's commitment to a peaceful, democratic relationship amid recent tensions.
title: S Jaishankar likely to meet his Bangladesh counterpart at UN

description: Ravichandran Ashwin, at the age of 38, continues to perform exceptionally in Test cricket with his off-spin and improved batting. His recent century against Bangladesh demonstrates his prowess. Ashwin attributes his success to enjoying the game and focusing on personal happiness rather than external pressures.
title: I want to play cricket with a smile on my face: Ravichandran Ashwin

description: Ravichandran Ashwin's century overshadowed Ravindra Jadeja's performance, who fell short of his fifth Test century. Despite this, Jadeja excelled with the ball. The Ashwin-Jadeja partnership remains pivotal for India, with both players appreciating and learning from each other’s strengths.
title: Ton missed, versatile Jadeja eyes next target: 300 Test wickets

description: Sri Lanka's presidential elections have started with 38 candidates in the race. The primary contenders are President Ranil Wickremesinghe, opposition leader Sajith Premadasa, and Marxist lawmaker Anura Kumara Dissanayake. Voting began at 7 am and will conclude by 4 pm. Results are expected by Sunday in this first election since the economic crisis two years ago.
title: Sri Lanka votes in first election since economic collapse: Key candidates

description: Former Bangladesh captain Shakib Al Hasan is using an innovative technique involving a black band between his teeth to improve his batting stance and head position in the first Test against India. Commentator Aakash Chopra explains that this method helps the left-handed batsman Shakib in keeping his head aligned with his right shoulder, aiding in better front-foot movement.
title: Why B'desh batter Shakib has a band between his teeth while batting

description: The Jharkhand government has decided to impose an internet ban across the state during the Jharkhand General Graduate Level Combined Competitive Examination. The ban will be in place from 8 am to 1:30 pm on September 21 and 22, affecting mobile internet and Wi-Fi services while allowing voice calls and fixed-line broadband to remain operational.
title: Jharkhand bans mobile internet across state to prevent cheating in exam

description: Cristiana Barsony-Arcidiacono, CEO of BAC Consulting, is under investigation after her company's pagers caused fatalities and injuries in Lebanon. Although she denies direct involvement, the pagers were licensed from Gold Apollo. Her career history shows inconsistencies and debunked claims about past roles. The investigation into the incident continues.
title: Speaks 7 languages, PhD holder: All about the woman linked to pagers blast

description: The Bombay High Court has struck down the Centre's amended IT rules that established a fact check unit to flag social media content about its functioning as 'fake, false or misleading'. The court found the unit unconstitutional due to its vagueness and potential chilling effect on free speech and trade.
title: Bombay HC strikes down Centre's fact check unit

description: Manipur CM Biren Singh's office has forwarded to police a purported intelligence alert about an influx of 900-odd tribal militants from Myanmar as part of a mission to launch attacks on villages in Imphal valley around Sept 28.
title: Manipur flags 'intel' on influx of 900 tribal rebels from Myanmar

description: Zerodha is warning its users about fake WhatsApp and Telegram groups used for scams. Fraudsters lure individuals with promises of financial advice, webinars, and stock tips using Zerodha's name. The company has posted alerts on X and advises users to report any suspicious accounts or groups impersonating Zerodha on social media platforms.
title: Zerodha has a warning against these WhatsApp and Telegram groups

description: Kamala Harris has strongly criticized Donald Trump and his party over their abortion policies, labeling them as hypocrites. She attributed Trump's abortion ban to the deaths of two women in Georgia and stressed the importance of addressing women's healthcare needs. Harris also condemned restrictive state laws enacted after Roe v. Wade was overturned.
title: 'How dare ... ': Kamala slams 'hypocrite' Trump on abortion ban

description: Apple has launched its new iPhone 16 series, which includes the iPhone 16, iPhone 16 Plus, iPhone 16 Pro, and iPhone 16 Pro Max. Through Apple's trade-in program, customers can get significant savings by exchanging their older models such as the iPhone 12 to iPhone 15. Trade-in values depend on the model and condition of the old device.
title: iPhone 16 on sale in India: How much Apple will give you for your old iPhones

description: Kate Middleton, the Princess of Wales, employs an effective parenting style that includes using the phrase 'let's take a break' to manage her children's behavior. Together with Prince William, they prefer open dialogue and maintain a 'no shouting' policy at home. This modern approach ensures a nurturing environment for their children.
title: Kate Middleton uses this parenting strategy to keep her kids disciplined

description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi has started his three-day visit to the US for attending the Quad summit and addressing 'Summit of the Future' at UNGA. He will meet President Joe Biden to discuss enhancing India-US relations. Additionally, he plans to engage with Indian diaspora and leading American business figures.
title: PM Modi on 3-day US visit for Quad summit: Key agenda, full schedule

description: Manipur CM Biren Singh's office has forwarded to police a purported intelligence alert about an influx of 900-odd tribal militants from Myanmar as part of a mission to launch attacks on villages in Imphal valley around Sept 28.
title: Manipur flags 'intel' on influx of 900 tribal rebels from Myanmar
Naidu seeks report on Tirupati laddus; don't politicise: Jagan

description: Union minister Nitin Gadkari stressed the importance of tolerating strong opinions in a democracy and encouraged thinkers to express their views freely. Addressing an event in Pune, he called for social harmony and equality, referencing Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj as a model of secularism.
title: Nitin Gadkari: Those at helm must tolerate barbs

description: The labour ministry is probing the death of Ernst & Young India employee Anna Sebastian Perayil, whose family claims she faced extreme work pressure. Her father highlighted her demanding schedule. EY chairman Rajiv Memani expressed regret for missing her funeral but denied that work-related stress caused her death.
title: Not taking EY to court, says dead CA's father

description: The Secret Service admitted to communication failures and operational lapses during a shooting incident at Donald Trump's rally in Butler, Pennsylvania. Acting director Ronald Rowe Jr stressed the importance of accountability and improving security measures. Disciplinary actions are being considered for involved personnel, with plans to expand the security perimeter to prevent future incidents.
title: 'Lessons learned...': Secret Service admits failures in Trump shooting

description: The Karnataka High Court's Dharwad bench advised a divorcing couple to consult Sri Gavisiddeshwara Swamiji of Gavi Mutt, Koppal, for resolving their differences. Justice Krishna S Dixit emphasized addressing marital issues rather than opting for separation. The court directed the couple to meet the spiritual guru this Sunday for guidance.
title: Karnataka HC asks couple to seek spiritual guru's help to save marriage

description: A 30-year-old man was fatally beaten in Kanpur's Shastri Chowk area. The assault, reportedly ordered by a history-sheeter recently released on bail, happened after the victim and his sister filed a police complaint against him. Authorities are waiting for an official complaint to advance the investigation.
title: Man killed on Kanpur road as sis stays firm on testifying against goon

description: Rishabh Pant made his Test comeback in the first Test against Bangladesh in Chennai, the first red-ball international for him since a car accident in December 2022. His fearless and entertaining approach to cricket earned praise from former Australia wicketkeeper-batsman Adam Gilchrist.
title: 'Fearless' Pant gets big thumbs-up from this legend

description: A man from Punjab returned from Lebanon after 23 years because he had lost his passport there in 2006 and all attempts to return home failed. He was reunited with his family after RS MP Baba Balbir Singh Seechewal took up his case with the MEA.
title: Stuck in Lebanon for 23 years, Punjab man back home

description: Rinson Jose, 37, from Kerala's Wayanad who briefly trained for the clergy before migrating to Norway has emerged as an alleged link in the pager blasts that killed 12 in Lebanon. Norta Global Ltd, a 'tech firm' based in Sofia, Bulgaria, allegedly owned by Jose, is being probed by international security agencies following reports linking it to the sale of the pagers.
title: Kerala-born Norwegian linked to pager blasts?

description: Rinson Jose, 37, from Kerala's Wayanad who briefly trained for the clergy before migrating to Norway has emerged as an alleged link in the pager blasts that killed 12 in Lebanon. Norta Global Ltd, a 'tech firm' based in Sofia, Bulgaria, allegedly owned by Jose, is being probed by international security agencies following reports linking it to the sale of the pagers.
title: Kerala-born Norwegian linked to pager blasts?
Naidu seeks report on Tirupati laddus; don't politicise: Jagan
MG slashes Comet's price by Rs 2L to Rs 5L with battery rental model
No immediate legal view on SC's telecom AGR call: Govt

description: Cases where Sebi chairperson Madhabi Puri Buch recused herself due to potential conflict of interest are not "readily" available and collating them would "disproportionately divert" resources, Sebi said Friday in an RTI response.
title: Sebi: Cases where Buch recused herself not 'readily available'
Speeding car causes chaos in Lucknow, injures several

description: In the first phase of Jammu & Kashmir elections, women voters surpassed men in six out of 24 constituencies, with an overall turnout of 61.4%. Five constituencies in Jammu division recorded higher female participation, while only one did so in Kashmir Valley. Despite this, male voter turnout remained higher overall.
title: Women turnout exceeds that of men in six J&K seats in Phase-1

description: Bengal lifted its border blockade against Jharkhand at 6.30pm Friday, opening the floodgates for traffic that had been stalled for 20 hours after CM Mamata Banerjee had sealed the border accusing DVC of "flooding Bengal to save Jharkhand".
title: Didi talks to Soren, lifts J'khand border blockade after 20 hrs

description: Rohit Sharma has had a challenging outing with the bat in the first Test against Bangladesh. The Indian captain's frustration was evident when a fielder wasn't attentive to his instructions on the field. At stumps on Day 2, India, who decided to not enforce the follow-on, were at 81 for 3, which gave the hosts an overall lead of 308 runs so far.
title: Rohit gets angry at team-mate: 'Soye hue hain sab log' - Watch

description: Sibi Joseph, father of the late Anna Sebastian Perayil, has spoken about his daughter's death due to work-related stress at EY. He disclosed that Anna faced severe sleep and food deprivation. Her mother's letter to EY's chairman highlighted the excessive workload on newcomers, prompting public concern over employee welfare.
title: EY employee's death: Anna Sebastian's father appeals to the company
Over two dozen ex-militants, separatists, former Jamaat members in J&K poll fray
